definition: too bad/unfortunately/as luck would have it

sentences.english: They decided to have something to eat before going to home, but unfortunately the only spot open was a seedy bar-and-grill with a questionable reputation.
sentences.chinese: 但很不巧只有一家名声不好的下等酒吧烤菜馆开着门。

sentences.english: Unfortunately for them, Podolski's finishing was erratic throughout the whole game.
sentences.chinese: 可不巧的是，整场波多尔斯基的射门大失水准。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, I made an inadvertent remark about Irma's failure while she was present.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛在场时，很不巧我冒失地提到了她的失败。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, I'll go to see my parents that day.
sentences.chinese: 真不巧，那天我要去看望我的父母。

sentences.english: Well, unfortunately that still is not possible.
sentences.chinese: 不巧的是这仍然不可行。

sentences.english: Oberon: I'll meet by moonlight, proud Titania.
sentences.chinese: 真不巧又在月光下遇见你，傲慢的泰妲妮亚。

sentences.english: Not coincidentally, it will be about half the size.
sentences.chinese: 不巧，届时展出的规模将会是现在的一半。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, I have forgotten my three-digit access code.
sentences.chinese: 但不巧的是，我忘记了进入语音信箱的三位数密码。

sentences.english: Unluckily, it was a heap of dead rabbits.
sentences.chinese: 不巧的是，那是一堆死兔子。

sentences.english: They decided to have somethellong to eat before goint home, but unfortunately the only spot open was a seedy bar-and-grill with a questionable reputation.
sentences.chinese: 但很不巧只有一家名声欠好的劣等酒吧烤菜馆开着门。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, it appears to be the result of some underhanded dealings.
sentences.chinese: 不巧的是，这其实是地下交易的结果。

sentences.english: Scotland, not coincidentally, has pristine rivers.
sentences.chinese: 不巧的是，苏格兰有原始的河流。

sentences.english: She struck forth, unfortunately hitting the jug of honey above the bed.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手一敲，不巧打着了床头的蜂蜜罐。

sentences.english: On the table lay an unfortunate copy of the famous Touquet Charter.
sentences.chinese: 桌子上不巧正摆着一份著名的杜凯宪章。

sentences.english: They decided to have something to eat before goint home, but unfortunately the only spot open was a seedy bar-and-grill with a questionable reputation.
sentences.chinese: 但很不巧只有一家名声欠好的劣等酒吧烤菜馆开着门。

definition: just by chance/to happen to (just at the right time)/opportune
by coincidence/it so happened that/fortunately/against expectation
as it turns out/by lucky coincidence/(of number, time, size etc) just right
just (in time)/just right/just enough/to happen to/to chance to/by chance/it just so happens that
who would have thought that/who would have expected that
